posts.cooked: Hi guys, we plan to use 2 servos to ‘open’ the bottom of our intake for deep cage. I think they are mg996s. Does anyone have experience on that?  It’s my first time dealing with servos so I don’t know much about both its wiring and programming.

posts.name: evanperryg
posts.cooked:
It’s been the better part of a decade since I drove a servo with a RIO and I don’t know anything about your specific model of servo, but yes it absolutely should be possible.

The overwhelming majority of servos use exactly the same signaling, and it’s also the same signaling that all the motor controllers use in PWM mode. Here’s everything you could ever want to know . Just plug it into the RIO. It’ll go. Make sure it wants 6V first.

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked:
enc0unt3r:

mg996s

One of those might be capable of pulling more amps than the PWM 6v bus can deliver (at least the MG996R is). If you have a too heavy load, then use something like a servo hub .

posts.name: evanperryg
posts.cooked: Yes, to be clear: when I said “plug it into the RIO, it’ll go” that meant “plug it straight into the RIO to prove it works, then wire it properly once you know it’s working.” I’m still waking up.
Oh they are MG996Rs. In a Chinese-speaking context we’d often refer to such devices using just the numbers as abbreviations (my mentor just told me its ‘996’ lol). Thank you for your reply!
OK I’ll try this out later. Thank u!
